description: MANILA, Philippines—Torrential rain set off by an approaching tropical storm swamped the eastern Philippines with widespread flooding that killed at least nine people, trapped others on their roofs, and sparked frantic appeals for help, officials said Wednesday. The government shut down public schools and government offices—except those urgently needed for disaster response—on the entire main […]
title: Floods in Philippines Kill at Least 9 and Trap Others on Roofs as Storm Approaches

description: OTTAWA—The Bank of Canada cut its key interest rate for the fourth time in 2024, bringing it down to 3.75 percent. “We took a bigger step today because inflation is now back to the 2 percent target and we want to keep it close to the target,” Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem said on […]
title: Bank of Canada Takes ‘Bigger Step,’ Cuts Rate By Half Point to 3.75

description: The agreement delivers on the government's pledge to strike a new defence relationship with Germany and represents efforts to 'reset' relations with Europe.
title: UK and Germany Sign ‘Landmark’ Defence Treaty

description: The IDF said the bunker had been used by Hezbollah’s former leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, who was killed in an Israeli airstrike last month.
title: IDF Says It Won’t Strike Beirut Hospital With Hezbollah Cash Bunker Underneath It

description: Green Leader Sonia Furstenau is set to meet the media for the first time since British Columbia’s indecisive election on Saturday, amid speculation about a possible minority government. The Greens announced Tuesday that Furstenau is staying on as leader despite losing her seat in the legislature, saying she was “instrumental” in B.C.’s 2017 minority government […]
title: Furstenau to Speak as Prospects Loom for Minority Government in BC

description: A debate has ground work in the House of Commons to a halt for weeks, but a new poll suggests that most Canadians are not even aware it’s happening. In a new survey from polling firm Leger, 55 percent of respondents said they had not heard about the procedural issues that have gridlocked Parliament for […]
title: Poll Suggests More Than Half of Canadians Unaware of Gridlock in House of Commons

description: MEXICO CITY—A shootout near the capital of Mexico’s Sinaloa state killed 19 suspected gang members, while one local cartel leader was arrested, Mexico’s defense ministry said on Tuesday, as intra-cartel violence intensifies. The deadly altercation on Monday took place about 7 miles outside the Sinaloa capital of Culiacan, when a group of more than 30 […]
title: Shootout in Mexico’s Sinaloa State Kills 19, Local Cartel Leader Arrested

description: The campaign accused Labour of making 'illegal foreign national contributions' to the Harris for President campaign.
title: Trump Campaign Files Complaint Accusing UK Labour Party of ‘Foreign Interference’

description: The prison population has roughly doubled in the last 30 years, increasing by around 4,500 annually.

description: A University of Sydney study shows overweight children cost $19,700 more than healthy-weight children, while obese children cost up to $46,700.

description: It appears New Zealand is caught up in the investigation of a leak of classified documents that contain the US's assessment of Israeli plans to attack Iran.

description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico—Five people were killed and several injured in a shooting at a soccer match in Jamaica, according to police. The shooting occurred in the capital of Kingston late Monday during a friendly game, police told reporters. It wasn’t immediately clear how many people were injured or what led to the shooting. The […]
title: Shooting at a Soccer Match in Jamaica Leaves 5 Dead and Several Injured

description: MEXICO CITY—Kristy strengthened into a hurricane in the eastern Pacific Ocean on Tuesday and was expected to remain away from land as the storm grows more powerful, forecasters said. The storm was 590 miles west-southwest of Acapulco, Mexico, and was moving west at 18 mph. It had maximum sustained winds of 75 mph, according to […]
title: Kristy Strengthens Into Hurricane in Eastern Pacific Ocean

description: LONDON—Adam Staples knew he’d found something when his metal detector let out a beep. And then another. And another. Soon “it was just ‘beep beep, beep beep, beep beep,’” Staples said. In a farmer’s field in southwest England, Staples and six friends had found a hoard of more than 2,500 silver coins that had lain […]
title: Hoard of 1,000-Year-Old Coins Unearthed in Farmer’s Field Sells for $5.6 Million

description: Of advanced economies, only Slovakia is predicted to surpass Australia at 4.8 percent.
title: Australia to Experience 2nd Highest Inflation Rate Among Developed Nations in 2025: IMF
